p: The AESG orally administered to experimental rats was relatively safe with LD 50 above 5000 mg/kg. AESG appeared to have elicited alterations in plasma ALP and bilirubin levels. Nonetheless, it did not result to elevations in specific liver enzymes and non-enzyme indicators; no hepatocellular, glomerular or myocardial damages were prominent, suggesting that AESG was neither significantly toxic nor resulted in injury to vital organs; may be safely administered at lower doses.
